00010 #define SERVER_FUNC(x) \
00011                 static handler_t x(server *srv, void *p_d)
00012 
00013 #define CONNECTION_FUNC(x) \
00014                 static handler_t x(server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d)
00015 
00016 #define INIT_FUNC(x) \
00017                 static void * x(server *srv)
00018 /*
00019  * The PATCH_OPTION() macro is used in the patch_connection() functions
00020  * of the modules to update the config object for the current request.
00021  */
00022 #define PATCH_OPTION(x) \
00023                 p->conf.x = s->x

00025 #define FREE_FUNC          SERVER_FUNC
00026 #define TRIGGER_FUNC       SERVER_FUNC
00027 #define SETDEFAULTS_FUNC   SERVER_FUNC
00028 #define SIGHUP_FUNC        SERVER_FUNC
00029 
00030 #define SUBREQUEST_FUNC    CONNECTION_FUNC
00031 #define JOBLIST_FUNC       CONNECTION_FUNC
00032 #define PHYSICALPATH_FUNC  CONNECTION_FUNC
00033 #define REQUESTDONE_FUNC   CONNECTION_FUNC
00034 #define URIHANDLER_FUNC    CONNECTION_FUNC

00036 #define PLUGIN_DATA        size_t id
00037 
00046 typedef struct {
00047         size_t version;
00048 
00049         buffer *name; /* name of the plugin */
00050 
00051         void *(* init)                       (server *srv);
00052         handler_t (* set_defaults)           (server *srv, void *p_d);
00053         handler_t (* cleanup)                (server *srv, void *p_d);
00054                                                                                            /* is called ... */
00055         handler_t (* handle_trigger)         (server *srv, void *p_d);                     /* once a second */
00056         handler_t (* handle_sighup)          (server *srv, void *p_d);                     /* at a signup */
00057 
00058         handler_t (* handle_uri_raw)         (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* after uri_raw is set (mod_rewrite) */
00059         handler_t (* handle_uri_clean)       (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* after uri is set (mod_access, mod_auth) */
00060         handler_t (* handle_docroot)         (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* getting the document-root (e.g. mod_simple_vhost) */
00061         handler_t (* handle_physical)        (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* mapping url to physical path (e.g. mod_alias, mod_proxy_core) */
00062         handler_t (* handle_start_backend)   (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* file exists locally (e.g. mod_staticfile) */
00063         handler_t (* handle_send_request_content)(server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d); /* a handler for the request content */
00064         handler_t (* handle_response_header) (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* a handler for the request content */
00065         handler_t (* handle_read_response_content)(server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d); /* read the content from the source and push it to the next queue */
00066         handler_t (* handle_filter_response_content)(server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d); /* apply filters to response content (compression/chunk encoding/ etc..) */
00067         handler_t (* handle_response_done)   (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* after the response is sent (e.g. mod_accesslog) */
00068         handler_t (* connection_reset)       (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* end of a request-response cycle (mod_acceslog, mod_proxy_core) */
00069         handler_t (* handle_connection_close)(server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* at the end of a connection [remove-me ?] */
00070         handler_t (* handle_joblist)         (server *srv, connection *con, void *p_d);    /* after all events are handled [remove-me ?] */
00071 
00072         void *data;
00073 
00074         /* dlopen handle */
00075         void *lib;
00076 
00077         array *required_plugins;
00078 } plugin;
